intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Mmm... The air is sweet here. It's so calming.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Makes you want to just flop down and take a huge nap, doesn't it?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Odd. It seems like anywhere else to me...

intro.speaker: Say'Ri
intro.line: This is Naga's Cradle. It is said the divine dragon once called this place home. Here, the Voice will enact a holy rite to commune with Naga and regain her power.

intro.speaker: Say'Ri
intro.line: Pray be silent, milady. The Voice is currently performing the rite. In doing so, she will draw the divine dragon's power from the land unto herself.

intro.speaker: Lucina
intro.line: Forgive me, I didn't realize. I thought she was sleeping... She looks so peaceful. What do you think she sees? Does she perchance dream?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I imagine she— ...Uh-oh. Is that what I think it is? Say'ri! Lucina! Enemies approach us from the south. We'd better get ready, or the Voice here is in for a rude awakening.

battle.speaker: Say'Ri
battle.line: The Voice is defenseless in this state. We must become her shield until the rite is complete. We await your strategy, Robin. Make us as a wall of steel!

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Yes, thanks to you. I apologize for the delay, but the rite has borne fruit.

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: You've taken in the power of the divine dragon?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Some of it, yes. ...It's strange. This power had always isolated me. Many were the days I wept alone, cursing the charge placed before me...

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: But now my power has a purpose, and the world needs it to avoid a ruinous future. And so I shall offer it freely. Allow me to join you.

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: I am. I've had quite enough of living in solitude, thank you. Besides, I've always longed to better know this world. Now I can help you save it.

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: For all the talk of power, she was a gentle soul, and far too fragile...

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Indeed. But I fear there's no time to grieve, Say'ri. We must keep moving. We'll try to bring her peace by securing it for the world.
